Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown glaze, with lotus flower in added red and white and incised outline above red band lines in white; exterior, cream slip: below, rear of goat moving left, red on haunch; upper frieze with black figure floral decoration; filling ornaments: dots, dotted rosettes and pendant roundels.
Curator's comments: Part of 1888,0601.534a-d & f-g, from high up on the wall.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.229)
